name: Creating a Compute Instance
description: Walkthrough on creating a Internet Gateway.

steps.message: In this tutorial will go over steps on creating a compute instance. We will create a Linux VM, but you can change the image to any. Note: A VCN, and compartment must already be created.

Click the menu button on top left. Scroll down to "Compute" and click "Instances".
{{img-url:/images/tutorials/computemenu.png}}

Click Create Instance. Choose a name. For high availability there are 3 Availability Domains per region. Choose one where a subnet is available. Under "Operating System" choose your image, for this tutorial we will choose the default Oracle Linux 7.

Choose Virtual Machines. Tip:Bare Metal is required if you don't need virtualization.
For now choose VMs. To determine OCPU number and RAM GB size, OCI uses shapes for the different configurations of both. Choose any available or depending on workload.

Add your public key in order to SSH into your instance. Under Networking choose the VCN you created before and the subnet. Skip Advanced Settings for now. </br> Click Create to create your first compute instance.
For more information on computes go to the documentation.
